Articles.Content:
Hi everyone.

I was looking over some [I]Ancient[/I] threads and saw that some users only posted one post, and then vanished.

I'm now wondering if there is some User Deletion thing on the forums.

Like if a person hasn't posted in 3 years they get deleted.

Thank you for reading!
I think that the forum has had migrations, and also the dreaded memory wipes we all know and hate.
[url=http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/54662-HMV]I know for a fact that users who have been around for over 3 years with 0 posts won't get deleted[/url].

[quote name='5thHorseman'][url=http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/members/54662-HMV]I know for a fact that users who have been around for over 3 years with 0 posts won't get deleted[/url].[/QUOTE]

I assume that was an old account from when you went to HMV gaming or was it a random account you found?

[quote name='legoclone09']I assume that was an old account from when you went to HMV gaming or was it a random account you found?[/QUOTE]
5thHorseman wanted to change his name to HMV, but it was already taken.

We don't delete inactive accounts. They might become active again, sometimes in [URL="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/106853"]hilarious ways[/URL].

Bummer about the name change, 5thHorseman, though it would be strange seeing you post under another name.

[quote name='Red Iron Crown']Bummer about the name change, 5thHorseman, though it would be strange seeing you post under another name.[/QUOTE]

I change my online name every 7 years, give or take. This'd be the first time the new name was related in any way to the old.

[quote name='legoclone09']I assume that was an old account from when you went to HMV gaming or was it a random account you found?[/QUOTE]

Both.

I was looking at [I]old[/I] craft in the spacecraft exchange and then I saw HMV
